title: Lucky seal escapes the clutches of a brown bear when Russian fishermen spook the hungry predator
text:
A seal being attacked by a brown bear managed to escape after passing Russian fisherman grunted at the predator.

One of the two fishermen recorded the incident in Russia's far east, spotting the bear biting into the flesh of the Baikal seal.

As their boat approaches, one of the fishermen makes a grunting sound, prompting the bear to sprint away, allowing the seal to start shuffling down the sand towards the safety of the water.

One of the fishermen recorded the incident in Russia's Far East, spotting the bear biting into the flesh of the Baikal seal

Local media report brown bears, unlike polar bears, are rarely interested in Baikal seals as prey.

One commenter who saw the footage online said: 'I bet this bear wasn't too hungry. Otherwise it would have snacked on the seal, and both of these fishermen.'

Another said: 'Well, who is going to save the fish that this seal will decide to have for lunch?!'

A third said: 'Yes, they did save this seal. But what about humans? This bear is now hungry and might attack a person. Has anyone thought of that?'
description: One of the fishermen recorded the incident in Russia's far east, spotting the bear biting into the flesh of the Baikal seal. As their boat approaches the scene, the bear sprints away and the seal flees.
